message_1:
Let P(x) be the statement "x is a prime number" and Q(x) be the statement "x is an odd number". Write the predicate logic statement for "There exists a prime number that is also odd".

∃x(P(x) ∧ Q(x))
message_2:
That's correct! The predicate logic statement for "There exists a prime number that is also odd" is:

∃x(P(x) ∧ Q(x))
